intro: Impatiens sasidharanii, commonly known as the Sasidharan’s Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous species characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically blooms in shades of pink and white, with five petals that are often adorned with a distinctive yellow or orange stripe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and unique floral morphology, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
